forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 44. Northeast wind 7 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. East southeast wind 6 to 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a delicate veil of uncertainty hangs in the air, hinting at the rain promised by the forecast. The sky, partly cloaked in clouds, casts a muted light over the city, while a gentle northeast wind stirs, whispering the possibility of moisture to come. Tonight, temperatures will dip to a cool 44 degrees, and as the clock ticks towards the early morning hours, an anticipated fifty percent chance of rain is likely to awaken the city. The streets may shimmer with dew, inviting the intimate quiet typically held after sunset.

On Thursday, a complete transformation is expected as the rain will blanket the city, its steady rhythm offering a symphony for the senses. With heights near 57 degrees, a chill will nestle into the afternoon hours, sending temperatures gracefully lower. Those venturing outdoors should consider wrapping themselves in layers – a prepared jacket can serve as a shield against the forthcoming downpour and the brisk winds, which could dance around 22 mph. As the day approaches, consider wandering through sheltered enclaves of the city: perhaps a cozy café with a window seat from which to watch the world pass by, or tracing the paths of museum exhibits, where the artistry within can serve as balm against the tempest outside.
